Est % Complete: 0%.2020IDIS - PR28 Date: 27-Sep-2021 Page: INDIANA - Program Year 2020 765 of 86032713 - JEFFERSON COUNTY/CV-CV1-233/ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ED Direct Financial (18A) IDIS Year: 2020 UGLG: JEFFERSON COUNTY Activity to prevent, prepare for, and respond to Coronavirus: Yes Description: Jefferson County will utilize the $250,000 grant to establish a quick deploy, county- wide, LMI low-interest, 3-5 year RLF program for those businesses severely impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. The program provides immediate critical financial resources to smallmicro for-profit businesses for working capital, retention of LMI employees, and remote work capabilities. Estimated % Completed: 20%.2020IDIS - PR28 Date: 27-Sep-2021 Page: INDIANA - Program Year 2020 784 of 86032724 - WHITLEY COUNTY/CV-CV1-240/ADMINISTRATION General Program Administration (21A) National Objective: Grant Year: 2020 UGLG: Activity to prevent, prepare for, and respond to Coronavirus: Yes Description: Whitley County, the City of Columbia City and Columbia City Connect will partner with the Whitley County Economic Development Corporation (EDC) to establish a COVID-19 fund in their existing revolving loan fund program (RLF). The RLF was established in 2010 to create jobs and stimulate private investment in Whitley County by providing low-interest loans to individuals or businesses that are seeking to start or grow a business enterprise. The EDC maintains three different loan programs to assist with a broad array of business development opportunities. Due to the economic hardship caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, the Whitley County EDC will expand their RLF program to include a COVID-19 Fund. The purpose of the fund is to retain jobs, stimulate private investment and build long- term financial recovery in Whitley County by providing low-interest loans to small businesses throughout Whitley County. The COVID-19 Fund will supplement the existing programs by focusing investment in job retention. Furthermore, at least 51% of the jobs retained must be held by individuals who are considered low to moderate income. Eligible applicants are businesses geographically located in Whitley County with fewer than 100 employees. Applicants will receive free technical assistance through the EDC's Small Business and Entrepreneurship Initiative. Loans of up to $25,000 are available for a three year term, with an interest rate of 2%. A 1% loan servicing fee will be charged at loan closing. Loan applicants may request either a 6 month loan deferment period or loan forgiveness after two years, if the proposed jobs are still retained. Priority will be given to minority, women and veteran owned applicants. Next level of priority will be given to those firms which provideretain local jobs and export a product outside of the area. Those firms which provide for the sale of existing products which will be involved with sales outside of the area, but which will accrue back to the area, will be given the next level of consideration. Those firms which are involved strictly within the area with no potential for export of product will be given the lowest priority. To be eligible for this program you must be a small business (less than 100 employees) or a micro-enterprise (5 employees or less with one being the owner) for-profit entity. Owner andor employees must validate job retention meets the national objective of 51% or greater low-to-moderate income (LMI). Eligible activities include: working capital, continuation of operations, and to support remote work. Applications will be available through pdf download on the Rockville Mainstreet, Parke County Chamber, and Partnership Parke County websites. Applicants will also be instructed to download the upload Other-Intake Income Form to capture employee LMI status. Completed applications can be submitted to Partnership Parke County office. Applicants may apply for up to $25,000 from the LMI revolving loan program. An example of the application can be found in upload Other-Loan Application. Completed applications will be accepted between August 28 and September 18. The Selection Committee will score the completed applications using the upload Other- Scoring Sheet. All eligible loan requests will be shared with OCRA in early October as claims are submitted. Our anticipated impact is to help 10 businesses and retain at least 25 LMI jobs.
